title: Zbyněk Pospěch
text:
Zbyněk Pospěch (born 24 October 1982) is a <a href="Czech%20Republic">Czech</a> <a href="association%20football">football</a> <a href="Striker%20%28association%20football%29">forward</a> who plays for SV Oberndorf in <a href="Austria">Austria</a>.
Career.
Pospěch started his career with hometown side <a href="SFC%20Opava">Opava</a>, where he spent five years before later playing top-flight football for <a href="1.%20FC%20Slov%C3%A1cko">Slovácko</a> and <a href="FC%20Slovan%20Liberec">Slovan Liberec</a>. He then headed out of the Czech Republic, spending time at <a href="Odd%20Grenland">Odd Grenland</a> in Norway and <a href="Artmedia%20Bratislava">Artmedia Bratislava</a> in Slovakia. In 2009, he returned to the Czech Republic to play for <a href="1.%20FC%20Brno">Brno</a>.
Pospěch joined Second League side <a href="SFC%20Opava">Opava</a> in September 2009, five years after having left his boyhood club. In November 2009, the Czech Disciplinary Commission suspended Pospěch, which left him unable to play professional football until October 2010.
Pospěch moved on loan from Brno to <a href="SK%20Slavia%20Prague">Slavia Prague</a> in February 2011 until the end of June. Pospěch missed almost two years of league football before scoring on his return to action in a 1–0 win for Slavia Prague against former club <a href="FC%20Slovan%20Liberec">Slovan Liberec</a> in March 2011. He finished the spring part of the <a href="2010%E2%80%9311%20Czech%20First%20League">2010–11 Czech First League</a> as Slavia's top scorer with seven goals. In June 2011, as his loan was coming to an end, he signed a three-year contract with Slavia. Despite scoring a total of 13 league goals in a season and a half with Slavia, making him their leading scorer, Slavia terminated Pospěch's contract in June 2012, leaving him free to look for a new club.
After signing for <a href="FK%20Dukla%20Prague">Dukla Prague</a> in the summer of 2012, Pospěch took until October 2012 to score his first league goal for the club, which came in a 1–0 win against <a href="FC%20Hradec%20Kr%C3%A1lov%C3%A9">Hradec Králové</a>. He finished the season with 9 goals from 28 matches. Pospěch scored four goals in a match, becoming just the fifth player in the history of the Czech league to do so, in July 2013 during Dukla's 4–0 win against <a href="SK%20Sigma%20Olomouc">Sigma Olomouc</a>. He finished the month in second place in the league's Player of the Month competition behind <a href="FC%20Viktoria%20Plze%C5%88">Plzeň</a> striker <a href="Tom%C3%A1%C5%A1%20W%C3%A1gner">Tomáš Wágner</a>. In his second season at Dukla, he scored 16 goals, becoming the second highest scorer in the league for the season.
Pospěch signed a two year contract with German <a href="3.%20Liga">3. Liga</a> club <a href="Energie%20Cottbus">Energie Cottbus</a> in July 2014.
